# C++ Qt API client

# 

Flight Delay Prediction

- API version: 1.0.6
- Generator version: 7.9.0


Before using this API, we recommend you read our **[Authorization Guide](https://developers.amadeus.com/self-service/apis-docs/guides/authorization-262)** for more information on how to generate an access token.


*Automatically generated by the [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:

1. CMake 3.2+
2. Qt
3. C++ Compiler

## Getting Started

example.h:
```c++

#include <iostream>
#include "../client/OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi.h"

using namespace test_namespace;

class Example : public QObject {
    Q_OBJECT
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QDate create();
    QString create();
    QDate create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
public Q_SLOTS:
   void exampleFunction1();
};

```

example.cpp:
```c++

#include "../client/OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi.h"
#include "example.h"
#include <QTimer>
#include <QEventLoop>

QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QDate Example::create(){
    QDate obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QDate Example::create(){
    QDate obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
 return obj;
}

void Example::exampleFunction1(){
     OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi apiInstance;
     
      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString origin_location_code = create(); // QString | city/airport [IATA code](http://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx) from which the traveler is departing, e.g. PAR for Paris

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString destination_location_code = create(); // QString | city/airport [IATA code](http://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx) to which the traveler is going, e.g. PAR for Paris

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QDate departure_date = create(); // QDate | the date on which the traveler will depart from the origin to go to the destination. Dates are specified in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) YYYY-MM-DD format, e.g. 2019-12-25

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString departure_time = create(); // QString | local time relative to originLocationCode on which the traveler will depart from the origin. Time respects ISO 8601 standard. e.g. 13:22:00

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QDate arrival_date = create(); // QDate | the date on which the traveler will arrive to the destination from the origin. Dates are specified in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) YYYY-MM-DD format, e.g. 2019-12-25

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString arrival_time = create(); // QString | local time relative to destinationLocationCode on which the traveler will arrive to destination. Time respects ISO 8601 standard. e.g. 13:22:00

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString aircraft_code = create(); // QString | IATA aircraft code (http://www.flugzeuginfo.net/table_accodes_iata_en.php)

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString carrier_code = create(); // QString | airline / carrier code

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString flight_number = create(); // QString | flight number as assigned by the carrier

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIFlightDelayPredictionApi::getFlightDelayPredictionSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString duration = create(); // QString | flight duration in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) PnYnMnDTnHnMnS format, e.g. PT2H10M
      apiInstance.getFlightDelayPrediction(origin_location_codedestination_location_codedeparture_datedeparture_timearrival_datearrival_timeaircraft_codecarrier_codeflight_numberduration);
      QTimer::singleShot(5000, &loop, &QEventLoop::quit);
      loop.exec();
  }

```

## Documentation for Servers

Parameterized Servers are supported. Define a server in the API for each endpoint with arbitrary numbers of variables:

```yaml
servers:
- url: http://{server}:{port}/{basePath}
  description: Description of the Server
  variables:
    server:
        enum:
          - 'petstore'
          - 'qa-petstore'
          - 'dev-petstore'
        default: 'petstore'
    port:
      enum:
        - '3000'
        - '1000'
      default: '3000'
    basePath:
      default: v1
```
To change the default variable, use this function in each Api:
```c++
int setDefaultServerValue(int serverIndex,const QString &operation, const QString &variable,const QString &val);
```
The parameter "serverIndex" will choose a server from the server list for each endpoint. There is always at least one server with index 0. The Parameter "operation" should be the desired endpoint operationid.
Variable is the name of the variable you wish to change and the value is the new default Value.
The function will return -1 when the variable does not exists, -2 if value is not defined in the variable enum and -3 if the operation is not found.

If your endpoint has multiple server objects in the servers array, you can set the server that will be used with this function:
```c++
void setServerIndex(const QString &operation, int serverIndex);
```
Parameter "operation" should be your operationid. "serverIndex" is the index you want to set as your default server. The function will check if there is a server with your index.
Here is an example of multiple servers in the servers array. The first server will have index 0 and the second will have index 1.
```yaml
servers:
- url: http://{server}:8080/
  description: Description of the Server
  variables:
    server:
        enum:
          - 'petstore'
          - 'qa-petstore'
          - 'dev-petstore'
        default: 'petstore'
- url: https://localhost:8080/v1
```
